<td style="padding-top:20px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Good morning. </strong>Sometimes it’s necessary to step away from the crazy news cycle and ask the really important questions, such as: “What’s it like to go on a date during a pandemic?” </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Glad you asked. Today’s newsletter is a special edition Brew exploring the changing nature of dating and relationships in the coronavirus era. We’ll be back to our regularly scheduled programming on Monday...hope you enjoy!</p>

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
POLL
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/12/18/morning-brewharris-poll-finds-americans-split-pandemic-dating-attitudes?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Dating in 2020: Turns Out It <em>Could </em>Get More Awkward
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Masked man with flowers" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8zNDcxL21hc2tlZF9tYW5fd2l0aF9mbG93ZXJzLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Vladimir Gerdo\TASS via Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">We Brew writers spend a lot of time crafting a business newsletter that’s informative and non-face-meltingly-boring. Which means a lot of us are single. And when the pandemic hit, we weren’t sure if it was okay to keep swiping—or what we’d do if we found a promising connection. Nine months in, we still don’t have clear answers. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">So we asked around</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">A new Morning Brew/Harris poll found that many of you are using those thumbs like the Lord intended, and we don’t mean hitchhiking:</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Of respondents who had dated online before, more than two in five (42%) say they’re doing so more now compared to before the pandemic. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Apparently, quarantine can be the perfect time for romance—though not for everyone. 59% of respondents say they will be dating less once the pandemic is over, but 41% say they will date more. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>We’re similarly polarized on the topic of dating FOMO. 44% say they feel a great deal/some anxiety about losing time to pursue dating during the pandemic, but 56% feel none/not much anxiety about it. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">So what does a pandemic date look like? </strong>Those we polled said the ideal Covid-safe first date would involve meeting at an outdoor location (39%), video chatting virtually (35%), and staying socially distant with masks on (31%). </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>“The dating game in COVID is all screen and no scene,” said Harris Poll CEO John Gerzema. “While 40% are using dating apps more, 44% have anxiety over lost time dating in real life. Look for a dating boom when the vaccines reach the singles as almost half plan to date more once the pandemic is over.” </p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-top: 12px;">
<a href="https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2F2020%2F12%2F18%2Fmorning-brewharris-poll-finds-americans-split-pandemic-dating-attitudes" target="_blank" rel="noopener" style="text-decoration: none;" class="">
<img alt="" style="display: inline-block; width: 25px" width="25" src="https://media.sailthru.com/5z8/1k4/4/2/5e865734bf6f7.jpg">
</a><span>  </span>
<a href="https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?text=We+weren%E2%80%99t+sure+how+to+date+responsibly%2C+so+we+decided+to+ask+around+&url=https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/12/18/morning-brewharris-poll-finds-americans-split-pandemic-dating-attitudes&via=MorningBrew" target="_blank" rel="noopener" style="text-decoration: none;" class="">

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
TECH
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/12/18/dating-apps-see-increased-engagement-struggle-convert-dollars?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Thank Goodness for Zoom’s Enhance Appearance Feature
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="Woman looking at computer fixing hair " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=377 src="https://media.giphy.com/media/fWh7ETTpO6HhV1bYHQ/giphy.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="Woman looking at computer fixing hair " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.giphy.com/media/fWh7ETTpO6HhV1bYHQ/giphy.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Throughout the pandemic, dating app users starved of human interaction have been video chatting, swiping, and pickup-lining like they’re Tom Hanks in <em>Castaway</em>. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>The top 20 dating apps have gained </span><span><a href="https://www.marketplace.org/2020/11/24/love-in-the-time-of-covid-dating-apps-are-thriving/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">1.5 million daily active users</a></span><span> this year, according to Apptopia data from November. That’s a 180 from the before times, when downloads for the top 15 apps were actually </span><span><a href="https://www.emarketer.com/content/dating-app-growth-slows-but-advertisers-shouldnt-ignore-hopeful-single-users?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">shrinking</a></span><span> globally.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Users are <em>active</em>, active</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Video chatting on Bumble spiked 93% in the pandemic’s early days, while the average conversation length on Tinder <a href="https://newsroom.mtch.com/press-releases?item=122458&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">rose 10%–30%</a>. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>And yes, people are tapping the pandemic for pickup lines. OkCupid reported a </span><span><a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-03-20/online-dating-in-a-pandemic-coronavirus-keeps-singles-apart?sref=KkPzpZvz&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">188% increase</a></span><span> in coronavirus mentions on profiles between January and February. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">But business has been meh</strong>: Match Group, the owner of Tinder, Hinge, and PlentyOfFish, initially struggled to convert higher engagement into dollars. Average revenue per user <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/05/25/why-the-coronavirus-might-change-dating-forever.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">stayed flat</a> early this year, partly because users were less inclined to splurge on premium features if they knew the prospects of an in-person date were slim.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>Like WFHing, online courtship is likely to stick around even after the pandemic subsides. A survey conducted by Helen Fisher, the chief scientific adviser to dating site Match, found that 69% of survey respondents who participated in video chat dates said they would <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/how-the-covid-pandemic-will-change-online-dating-11607806800?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">continue to do so</a>. </p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
DEMOGRAPHICS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/12/18/covid19-baby-bust-us-see-500k-fewer-births-next-year?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Parents Right Now
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>

<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="parents gif " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=377 src="https://media.giphy.com/media/RK5LYiBbWw1HuBCxq7/giphy.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="parents gif " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.giphy.com/media/RK5LYiBbWw1HuBCxq7/giphy.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Looks like Baby Yoda scratched the itch for many prospective parents. Brookings researchers <a href="https://www.brookings.edu/blog/up-front/2020/12/17/the-coming-covid-19-baby-bust-update/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">estimate</a> 300,000 fewer births in the U.S. next year. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Okay, maybe the pandemic and accompanying recession are a better explanation. The think tank found that a 1% increase in unemployment correlates with a 1% decrease in births, and ongoing school/daycare closures could drop births further. Other variables weighing on parents:</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Reduced access to reproductive services </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Fears about coronavirus affecting a fetus </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Being home with children 24/7 (sounds mean, but if we had to spend the pandemic with our 13yo selves...)</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Reduced sexual activity (see above for why)</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">At the company level, baby product manufacturers are already seeing sales hits, and some are trying to <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/a-covid-baby-bust-is-bad-news-for-these-businesses-11605522600?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">develop premium products</a> to offset losses. At the macro level, this could skew the future workforce toward older people. The Covid-19 baby bust won't only “doesn't only depress overall productivity, but it also puts a burden on social insurance systems,” Brookings Senior Fellow Melissa Kearney <a href="https://www.businesscasual.fm/how-a-birth-bust-could-bust-the-economy/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">told <em>Business Casual</em></a>. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>Health and economic scares have caused birth busts before, including after the <a href="https://www.pewsocialtrends.org/2010/04/06/us-birth-rate-decline-linked-to-recession/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Great Recession</a>, Hong Kong’s SARS outbreak in 2013, and the 1918 Spanish flu.</p>

<img alt="Cardi B" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8zNDczL2NhcmRpX2IuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Prince Williams/WireImage</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Cardi B’s buying those Balenciagas that look like socks with a cool $8 million check from OnlyFans. The rapper reportedly makes that amount every month by posting behind-the-scenes content from her life to the platform, where admirers pay a monthly subscription fee for access. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Once known exclusively for NSFW content creators, OnlyFans has been <a href="https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/how-onlyfans-has-become-hollywoods-risque-pandemic-side-hustle?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">flooded by celebrities</a> who went looking for a new revenue stream when concerts, studio production, and other forms of live entertainment were put on pause. That and would-be daters seeking intimate connections have led to a pandemic-era boom for the company. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Creators on OnlyFans will generate more than </span><span><a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-12-05/celebrities-like-cardi-b-could-turn-onlyfans-into-a-billion-dollar-media-company?sref=KkPzpZvz&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">$2 billion in sales</a></span><span> this year, Bloomberg reports. The platform’s cut? Twenty percent, or $400 million. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>What’s even more mind-blowing are the profits. Of that $400 million in revenue, OnlyFans will make </span><span><a href="https://www.theinformation.com/articles/onlyfans-is-not-only-popular-but-hugely-profitable?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">$300 million in profit</a></span><span>, per The Information.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">For comparison:</strong> The sales generated by OnlyFans creators equal what creators on Patreon—another fan-fueled subscription site, but without the edgy reputation—have earned in all seven years of the platform's existence.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>The rise of creator-focused platforms like OnlyFans and Patreon (and also Substack and <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/12/14/kevin-office-will-bring-1-million-cameo-year?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Cameo</a>) is yet another trend accelerated by the pandemic. Similar to other big shifts in the entertainment industry, it boils down to getting content from creators —> consumers with the least amount of friction.</p>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
COMMUNITY
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/12/18/morning-brew-readers-share-quarantine-dating-stories?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Your Hilarious (and Sometimes Deep) Dating Stories
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="Lady and the Tramp" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=496 src="https://media.giphy.com/media/x28cIQSn19Tbi/giphy.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="Lady and the Tramp" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.giphy.com/media/x28cIQSn19Tbi/giphy.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, we asked you to share your quarantine-era dating stories. Some made us laugh, some made us cry, and others made us go, “Hmm, didn’t know masks could be used for that.” Here are our favorite responses: </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">“As I approached, the guy walked up to me and hugged me...the date was over at that moment in my mind.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Read the entire thing: </strong>“In May we met on Tinder and shortly thereafter started texting on WhatsApp. In October we had a video chat, but we didn’t say much, mostly just stared at each other. I bought her a plane ticket and last Thursday we met in Cabo San Lucas. We both returned home after the most incredible week of our lives. We are in love and have decided to pursue a long-term relationship. This all may not seem too unusual until you consider the fact that she is from Colombia and only speaks Spanish while I am from Los Angeles and only speak English. We use translator apps on our phones to communicate and we practiced each other’s languages together every morning.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">“I literally haven't touched another human being in over eight months.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">“Our first date was socially distant (meeting in a park for drinks). We really clicked and time passed super quick. Everything was great until I realized there aren't any bathrooms in the woods or natural segues to try and find one. And because we just met, neither one of us wanted to end the date because we had to pee. So we both were just suffering for hours because we were vibin'.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">“Did a virtual date for the first time. When the girl turned on her camera, I saw for a quick glance what was at least 50 crushed up Mountain Dew cans on the floor by her bed. I tried not to think anything of it until the conversation turned to what our favorite drinks were. To spice things up I said my favorite drink was Mountain Dew...she didn't bat an eye and proceeded to tell me she doesn't really drink soda. The call ended about 5 minutes later when I told her I can't date a liar.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">“First kiss was through two masks...three months later and we're in love <3.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">For more pandemic dating stories, check out the <a href="https://www.thesocialdistanceproject.org/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Social Distance Project</a>.</p>

Lawmakers will spend the weekend trying to put the finishing touches on a coronavirus relief package.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eCovid: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe FDA granted \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2020/12/18/moderna-covid-vaccine-approved-fda-for-emergency-use.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eemergency use authorization\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e to Moderna's vaccine (it already approved Pfizer-BioNTech's vaccine last week). The first shots could come as soon as Monday. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003c/th\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003c!--[if !mso style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nDating in 2020: Turns Out It \u003cem\u003eCould \u003c/em\u003eGet More Awkward\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"Masked man with flowers\" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8zNDcxL21hc2tlZF9tYW5fd2l0aF9mbG93ZXJzLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eVladimir Gerdo\\TASS via Getty Images\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWe Brew writers spend a lot of time crafting a business newsletter that’s informative and non-face-meltingly-boring. Which means a lot of us are single. And when the pandemic hit, we weren’t sure if it was okay to keep swiping—or what we’d do if we found a promising connection. Nine months in, we still don’t have clear answers. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eSo we asked around\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eA new Morning Brew/Harris poll found that many of you are using those thumbs like the Lord intended, and we don’t mean hitchhiking:\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eOf respondents who had dated online before, more than two in five (42%) say they’re doing so more now compared to before the pandemic. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eApparently, quarantine can be the perfect time for romance—though not for everyone. 59% of respondents say they will be dating less once the pandemic is over, but 41% say they will date more. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eWe’re similarly polarized on the topic of dating FOMO. 44% say they feel a great deal/some anxiety about losing time to pursue dating during the pandemic, but 56% feel none/not much anxiety about it. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eSo what does a pandemic date look like? \u003c/strong\u003eThose we polled said the ideal Covid-safe first date would involve meeting at an outdoor location (39%), video chatting virtually (35%), and staying socially distant with masks on (31%). \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003e“The dating game in COVID is all screen and no scene,” said Harris Poll CEO John Gerzema. “While 40% are using dating apps more, 44% have anxiety over lost time dating in real life. Look for a dating boom when the vaccines reach the singles as almost half plan to date more once the pandemic is over.” \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThroughout the pandemic, dating app users starved of human interaction have been video chatting, swiping, and pickup-lining like they’re Tom Hanks in \u003cem\u003eCastaway\u003c/em\u003e. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eThe top 20 dating apps have gained \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.marketplace.org/2020/11/24/love-in-the-time-of-covid-dating-apps-are-thriving/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e1.5 million daily active users\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e this year, according to Apptopia data from November. That’s a 180 from the before times, when downloads for the top 15 apps were actually \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.emarketer.com/content/dating-app-growth-slows-but-advertisers-shouldnt-ignore-hopeful-single-users?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eshrinking\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e globally.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eUsers are \u003cem\u003eactive\u003c/em\u003e, active\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eVideo chatting on Bumble spiked 93% in the pandemic’s early days, while the average conversation length on Tinder \u003ca href=\"https://newsroom.mtch.com/press-releases?item=122458\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003erose 10%–30%\u003c/a\u003e. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eAnd yes, people are tapping the pandemic for pickup lines. OkCupid reported a \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-03-20/online-dating-in-a-pandemic-coronavirus-keeps-singles-apart?sref=KkPzpZvz\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e188% increase\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e in coronavirus mentions on profiles between January and February. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBut business has been meh\u003c/strong\u003e: Match Group, the owner of Tinder, Hinge, and PlentyOfFish, initially struggled to convert higher engagement into dollars. Average revenue per user \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2020/05/25/why-the-coronavirus-might-change-dating-forever.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003estayed flat\u003c/a\u003e early this year, partly because users were less inclined to splurge on premium features if they knew the prospects of an in-person date were slim.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eLike WFHing, online courtship is likely to stick around even after the pandemic subsides. A survey conducted by Helen Fisher, the chief scientific adviser to dating site Match, found that 69% of survey respondents who participated in video chat dates said they would \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/how-the-covid-pandemic-will-change-online-dating-11607806800?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003econtinue to do so\u003c/a\u003e. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eLooks like Baby Yoda scratched the itch for many prospective parents. Brookings researchers \u003ca href=\"https://www.brookings.edu/blog/up-front/2020/12/17/the-coming-covid-19-baby-bust-update/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eestimate\u003c/a\u003e 300,000 fewer births in the U.S. next year. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eOkay, maybe the pandemic and accompanying recession are a better explanation. The think tank found that a 1% increase in unemployment correlates with a 1% decrease in births, and ongoing school/daycare closures could drop births further. Other variables weighing on parents:\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eReduced access to reproductive services \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eFears about coronavirus affecting a fetus \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eBeing home with children 24/7 (sounds mean, but if we had to spend the pandemic with our 13yo selves...)\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eReduced sexual activity (see above for why)\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAt the company level, baby product manufacturers are already seeing sales hits, and some are trying to \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/a-covid-baby-bust-is-bad-news-for-these-businesses-11605522600?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003edevelop premium products\u003c/a\u003e to offset losses. At the macro level, this could skew the future workforce toward older people. The Covid-19 baby bust won't only “doesn't only depress overall productivity, but it also puts a burden on social insurance systems,” Brookings Senior Fellow Melissa Kearney \u003ca href=\"https://www.businesscasual.fm/how-a-birth-bust-could-bust-the-economy/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etold \u003cem\u003eBusiness Casual\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/a\u003e. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eHealth and economic scares have caused birth busts before, including after the \u003ca href=\"https://www.pewsocialtrends.org/2010/04/06/us-birth-rate-decline-linked-to-recession/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eGreat Recession\u003c/a\u003e, Hong Kong’s SARS outbreak in 2013, and the 1918 Spanish flu.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eCardi B’s buying those Balenciagas that look like socks with a cool $8 million check from OnlyFans. The rapper reportedly makes that amount every month by posting behind-the-scenes content from her life to the platform, where admirers pay a monthly subscription fee for access. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eOnce known exclusively for NSFW content creators, OnlyFans has been \u003ca href=\"https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/how-onlyfans-has-become-hollywoods-risque-pandemic-side-hustle?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eflooded by celebrities\u003c/a\u003e who went looking for a new revenue stream when concerts, studio production, and other forms of live entertainment were put on pause. That and would-be daters seeking intimate connections have led to a pandemic-era boom for the company. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eCreators on OnlyFans will generate more than \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-12-05/celebrities-like-cardi-b-could-turn-onlyfans-into-a-billion-dollar-media-company?sref=KkPzpZvz\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e$2 billion in sales\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e this year, Bloomberg reports. The platform’s cut? Twenty percent, or $400 million. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eWhat’s even more mind-blowing are the profits. Of that $400 million in revenue, OnlyFans will make \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.theinformation.com/articles/onlyfans-is-not-only-popular-but-hugely-profitable?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e$300 million in profit\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e, per The Information.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eFor comparison:\u003c/strong\u003e The sales generated by OnlyFans creators equal what creators on Patreon—another fan-fueled subscription site, but without the edgy reputation—have earned in all seven years of the platform's existence.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eThe rise of creator-focused platforms like OnlyFans and Patreon (and also Substack and \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/12/14/kevin-office-will-bring-1-million-cameo-year?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eCameo\u003c/a\u003e) is yet another trend accelerated by the pandemic. Similar to other big shifts in the entertainment industry, it boils down to getting content from creators —\u003e consumers with the least amount of friction.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYesterday, we asked you to share your quarantine-era dating stories. Some made us laugh, some made us cry, and others made us go, “Hmm, didn’t know masks could be used for that.” Here are our favorite responses: \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e“As I approached, the guy walked up to me and hugged me...the date was over at that moment in my mind.”\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eRead the entire thing: \u003c/strong\u003e“In May we met on Tinder and shortly thereafter started texting on WhatsApp. In October we had a video chat, but we didn’t say much, mostly just stared at each other. I bought her a plane ticket and last Thursday we met in Cabo San Lucas. We both returned home after the most incredible week of our lives. We are in love and have decided to pursue a long-term relationship. This all may not seem too unusual until you consider the fact that she is from Colombia and only speaks Spanish while I am from Los Angeles and only speak English. We use translator apps on our phones to communicate and we practiced each other’s languages together every morning.”\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e“I literally haven't touched another human being in over eight months.”\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e“Our first date was socially distant (meeting in a park for drinks). We really clicked and time passed super quick. Everything was great until I realized there aren't any bathrooms in the woods or natural segues to try and find one. And because we just met, neither one of us wanted to end the date because we had to pee. So we both were just suffering for hours because we were vibin'.”\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e“Did a virtual date for the first time. When the girl turned on her camera, I saw for a quick glance what was at least 50 crushed up Mountain Dew cans on the floor by her bed. I tried not to think anything of it until the conversation turned to what our favorite drinks were. To spice things up I said my favorite drink was Mountain Dew...she didn't bat an eye and proceeded to tell me she doesn't really drink soda. The call ended about 5 minutes later when I told her I can't date a liar.”\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e“First kiss was through two masks...three months later and we're in love \u003c3.”\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eFor more pandemic dating stories, check out the \u003ca
